1.description: Now thirteen years old and entering his second year at Camp Half-Blood. Still the only child of Poseidon at camp.

2.description: Plagued by nightmares about Grover being in danger. His connection to Grover through empathy link allows him to sense his friend's distress.

8.description: Embarks on an unofficial quest to find the Golden Fleece and rescue Grover. Determined to save his best friend despite not being chosen for the quest.

13.description: His powers over the sea help him navigate the Sea of Monsters and communicate with sea creatures like Rainbow the hippocampus.

19.description: Successfully retrieves the Golden Fleece and helps restore Thalia's tree, though this also brings Thalia back to life. Proves himself as a true hero.

1.description: Now thirteen years old and still head counselor of Athena cabin. Becomes increasingly worried about the camp's defenses failing.

4.description: Devastated when Thalia's tree is poisoned and the camp's magical borders begin to fail. Understands the strategic importance of the Golden Fleece.

8.description: Joins Percy's unofficial quest to find the Golden Fleece, despite Clarisse being the official quest leader. Her wisdom is crucial to their success.

17.description: Uses her intelligence to help solve the riddles and challenges they face, particularly in Polyphemus's cave. Her invisible cap proves invaluable.

1.description: Now a licensed searcher looking for Pan, the lost god of the wild. Has been missing from camp for months on his search.

2.description: Discovered through Percy's dreams to be trapped and in danger. Sends empathic distress signals to Percy through their psychic bond.

15.description: Trapped in Polyphemus's cave on an island in the Sea of Monsters. The cyclops plans to marry him, thinking he's a female cyclops in a wedding dress.

18.description: Rescued from Polyphemus and helps recover the Golden Fleece. His searcher skills prove valuable in navigating the Sea of Monsters.

2.description: A large, homeless boy who befriends Percy at Meriwether Prep. Other kids pick on him for being different, but he's gentle and loyal.

3.description: Reveals incredible strength when defending Percy from Laistrygonian giants. His eye doesn't work quite right, and he has an unusual fear of fire.

4.description: Revealed to be a Cyclops and Percy's half-brother, also a son of Poseidon. Cyclopes are immune to fire and have incredible strength and building skills.

5.description: Joins Camp Half-Blood but faces discrimination from other campers who distrust monsters. Only Percy and some others accept him fully.

8.description: Joins Percy's quest to find the Golden Fleece. His cyclops abilities, especially his immunity to fire and strength, make him valuable.

19.description: Proves his worth as a hero and gains acceptance at camp. Poseidon takes him to work in the cyclopes' forges, making weapons for the gods.
19.role: Heroic son working for the gods

1.description: Still head counselor of Ares cabin and maintains her rivalry with Percy. Continues to be aggressive and confrontational.

6.description: Chosen by the Oracle to lead the quest to retrieve the Golden Fleece. Given this honor despite her past failures and hot temper.

8.description: Reluctantly accepts Percy's help on the quest, though she resents his interference. Her ship CSS Birmingham is a Confederate ironclad.

19.description: Successfully completes her quest and gains respect at camp. Proves herself as a capable leader despite her abrasive personality.

4.description: Her tree form has been poisoned, causing the magical borders of Camp Half-Blood to fail. The tree is dying, threatening the camp's safety.

19.description: The Golden Fleece not only heals her tree but brings her back to life as a fifteen-year-old daughter of Zeus. Her resurrection creates complications for the prophecy.

5.description: Temporary activities director replacing Chiron after Mr. D fires him. A spirit from the Fields of Punishment in the Underworld.

6.description: Cursed to eternal hunger and thirst - food and drink always move away from his reach. Takes sadistic pleasure in disciplining campers.

19.description: Sent back to the Underworld when Chiron is proven innocent and reinstated. His cruel reign over the camp finally ends.

4.description: Fired by Mr. D as activities director after being blamed for failing to keep Thalia's tree safe. Forced to leave Camp Half-Blood.

5.description: Living in exile, unable to help the camp in its time of crisis. His dismissal leaves the campers without his wise guidance and training.

19.description: Proven innocent of any wrongdoing and reinstated as activities director. Returns to help restore order and proper training to Camp Half-Blood.

15.description: A giant cyclops living on an island in the Sea of Monsters. Has captured Grover, whom he believes is a female cyclops he wants to marry.

16.description: Guards the Golden Fleece in his cave. Incredibly strong and dangerous, but not very intelligent. Has only one eye in the center of his forehead.

17.description: Blinded by Percy using a burning stick, just as Odysseus did in the ancient myths. This allows the heroes to escape with Grover and the fleece.

19.description: Appears briefly when Thalia is resurrected. Their reunion is tense as Thalia learns of his betrayal and service to Kronos.

4.description: Claimed Tyson as his son, making Percy and Tyson half-brothers. Shows his acceptance of both his demigod and cyclops children.

19.description: Takes Tyson to work in the underwater cyclopes forges, where weapons for the gods are made. Proud of both his sons' heroic deeds.

13.description: A hippocampus (half-horse, half-fish sea creature) who befriends Percy in the Sea of Monsters. Intelligent and able to communicate with Percy.

14.description: Helps Percy navigate the dangerous waters of the Sea of Monsters. Shows loyalty and bravery in helping the quest succeed.

11.description: An immortal sorceress who runs a health spa on an island. Known for turning men into animals, particularly pigs. Initially appears helpful and beautiful.

12.description: Turns Percy into a guinea pig and plans to keep him as a pet. Annabeth must rescue him using her wit and Hermes' multivitamins as an antidote.

4.description: Blames Chiron for the poisoning of Thalia's tree and fires him as activities director. Appoints Tantalus as his replacement.

19.description: Admits his mistake in firing Chiron and reinstates him as activities director. Sends Tantalus back to his eternal punishment.

8.description: Son of Hermes who accompanies Clarisse on her quest to find the Golden Fleece. Serves as her main quest companion.

3.description: Giant cannibals disguised as students at Meriwether Prep who attack Percy during dodgeball. Fire-breathing monsters from the far north.

2.description: A bully at Meriwether Prep who picks on Percy and Tyson. Represents the typical school antagonist.

3.description: Revealed to be a Laistrygonian giant in disguise during the dodgeball attack.
Another Laistrygonian giant disguised as a student who attacks Percy and Tyson during dodgeball.
The third Laistrygonian giant attacking Percy at school. Breathes fire like his brothers.

8.description: A bear twin, son of Ares and an evil queen. Works for Luke aboard the Princess Andromeda.
The other bear twin, brother to Agrius. Also serves Luke on the Princess Andromeda.

13.description: Ancient six-headed sea monster that guards the straits near Charybdis. Each head can swallow a man whole.

14.description: Attacks ships passing through her strait in the Sea of Monsters. Forces difficult choices on sailors.

13.description: Ancient whirlpool monster opposite Scylla that sucks in entire ships. Creates massive underwater vortexes.

9.description: Multi-headed water serpent that grows two heads for every one cut off. Attacks the CSS Birmingham.

10.description: Defeated when its heads are cauterized with fire to prevent regeneration.

13.description: Sea creatures with horse heads and fish tails that serve Poseidon. Can communicate with Percy underwater.

1.description: Various children of Hermes and unclaimed campers living in the overcrowded Cabin Eleven.

19.description: Goddess of the hunt and moon mentioned when discussing the gods' return to Olympus after the quest's success.
God of the sun, music, and healing. Mentioned as one of the Olympians pleased with the quest's success.

1.description: Goddess of wisdom and warfare, mother to Annabeth and the Athena cabin children.

4.description: God of fire and metalworking, father to the camp's craftsmen including those who made weapons.

19.description: Goddess of love and beauty, mentioned among the Olympians celebrating the heroes' success.
Goddess of agriculture and the harvest, pleased that the Golden Fleece will help restore natural balance.
Elder cyclopes who work in Poseidon's forges alongside Tyson. Master craftsmen of divine weapons.

8.description: Luke's cruise ship that serves as his mobile headquarters. Filled with monsters and rogue demigods.
Snake-tailed women serving as crew members on the Princess Andromeda. Fierce warriors with bronze weapons.

11.description: Magical leeches used by Circe in her spa treatments. Part of her enchantments to make visitors compliant.
Men transformed into guinea pigs by Circe's magic. Former pirates and sailors who visited her island.
A girl working at Circe's spa who seems different from the other attendants. Has a mysterious background.
Another girl at Circe's spa, sister to Reyna. Also seems more aware than the other enchanted attendants.

15.description: The legendary Golden Fleece that once belonged to the flying ram. Has incredible healing and protective powers.

19.description: Successfully heals Thalia's tree and restores Camp Half-Blood's borders, even bringing Thalia back to life.

13.description: Various sea monsters that attack ships in the Sea of Monsters. Ancient creatures of the deep.

12.description: Bird-like women who sing enchanting songs to lure sailors to their deaths on rocky shores.

13.description: Show Annabeth her greatest desire - redesigning the world with perfect architecture - to tempt her to stay.

8.description: Clarisse's Confederate ironclad warship given to her by her father Ares for the quest.

10.description: Severely damaged in battle with sea monsters but manages to reach Polyphemus's island.

4.description: Wild centaurs mentioned as some of the chaotic forces unleashed when the camp's borders fail.
Tree spirits at Camp Half-Blood whose trees are dying as the magical borders fail.
Water spirits in the camp's lake and streams, also affected by the failing borders.
Metallic birds with bronze beaks and sharp feathers that attack Camp Half-Blood when the borders weaken.

12.description: God of messengers and thieves who provides magical multivitamins that protect against Circe's magic.

3.description: Percy's celestial bronze sword disguised as a ballpoint pen. Effective against monsters.

8.description: Luke's sword made of both celestial bronze and steel, able to harm both mortals and immortals.

4.description: A bronze dragon that attacks Camp Half-Blood when the borders fail. Breathes fire and has impenetrable skin.

2.description: Vampire-like monsters disguised as cheerleaders at Meriwether Prep. Have bronze legs and donkey legs.

8.description: Bronze mechanical warriors serving Luke on the Princess Andromeda. Tireless metal soldiers.

19.description: Winged horses at Camp Half-Blood that help with transportation and aerial support.
Friendly centaurs led by Chiron who arrive to help defend Camp Half-Blood in the final battle.

8.description: Goddess of the rainbow who runs the Iris-message service for communication across distances.

4.description: The magical protective barriers around Camp Half-Blood powered by Thalia's tree, now failing due to poison.

19.description: Restored to full strength when the Golden Fleece heals Thalia's tree, making the camp safe again.
Army of cyclopes working for Poseidon in his underwater forges, where Tyson goes to work.
Nature spirits and minor deities who choose sides in the growing war between gods and Titans.

13.description: The mortal ferry captain who transports passengers near the Sea of Monsters, unaware of the supernatural dangers.
Mortal tourists on the ferry who cannot see through the Mist to perceive the true dangers around them.

11.description: Three ancient sisters who share one eye and one tooth, mentioned as part of the mythological world.

4.description: Other children of Poseidon mentioned in mythology, including both demigods and divine offspring.

2.description: Principal of Meriwether College Prep who deals with Percy's disciplinary issues and unusual incidents at school.
Percy's PE teacher at Meriwether Prep who supervises the fateful dodgeball game.
Student library assistant at Meriwether Prep who helps Percy with research.
School custodian who cleans up after the supernatural incidents at Meriwether Prep.
School lunch staff who serve food to students including Percy and Tyson.
Medical staff member who tends to injuries from bullying and the unusual incidents.

1.description: Head counselor of Hephaestus cabin, skilled in forging and metalwork. Creates weapons and tools for campers.
Head counselor of Aphrodite cabin, popular and beautiful camper known for her romantic advice.
Head counselor of Demeter cabin, skilled with plants and agriculture. Often at odds with the Stoll brothers.
One of the Stoll brothers from Hermes cabin, known for pranks and mischief around camp.
The other Stoll brother from Hermes cabin, partner in pranks with Connor.
Head counselor of Apollo cabin, skilled archer and healer who leads his siblings in camp activities.
Son of Apollo with exceptional healing abilities, works in the camp infirmary.
Son of Apollo known for his archery skills and competitive nature in camp games.
Daughter of Aphrodite known for her fashion sense and sometimes mean personality.
Son of Athena and Annabeth's second-in-command in Cabin Six. Intelligent and strategic.
Son of Hephaestus who works in the forges alongside Beckendorf.
Son of Aphrodite in Silena's cabin, interested in beauty and camp social dynamics.
One of the twin sons of Dionysus, co-head counselor of Cabin Twelve with his brother.
The other twin son of Dionysus, shares head counselor duties with Castor.

8.description: Son of Nemesis who has joined Luke's cause aboard the Princess Andromeda. Wears an eye patch.
Son of Hecate who serves Luke on the Princess Andromeda, skilled in magic and sorcery.
Several captured demigods held prisoner on the Princess Andromeda, forced to serve Luke's army.
Mortal crew member who prepares meals on the Princess Andromeda, unaware of the ship's true purpose.
Various crew members working in the Princess Andromeda's engine room, keeping the ship running.
Reanimated skeletal warriors serving as crew members on Luke's ship.
Cannibal giants serving as crew members aboard the Princess Andromeda.
Confederate spirit operating the CSS Birmingham's cannons under Ares' blessing.
Confederate spirit who helps navigate the CSS Birmingham through supernatural waters.
Confederate spirit maintaining the CSS Birmingham's steam engine and machinery.
Confederate spirit serving as lookout in the CSS Birmingham's crow's nest.

13.description: Massive sea monster with enormous tentacles that attacks ships in the Sea of Monsters.
Ocean spirits who sometimes help or hinder travelers in the Sea of Monsters.
Magical electric eels that can generate powerful electrical discharges in the sea.
Supernatural horses that breathe fire and can run on water, encountered in the Sea of Monsters.

14.description: Sharks with a single eye in the center of their head, distant relatives of cyclopes.

11.description: Enchanted women who work at Circe's spa, most unaware they're under magical influence.
Various visitors to Circe's spa who have been transformed into animals or made compliant.
Famous historical pirate transformed into a guinea pig by Circe's magic.
Historical Spanish explorer transformed into a guinea pig by Circe.
Ancient Viking transformed into a guinea pig, retains some fighting spirit even in animal form.
Contemporary business executive transformed into a guinea pig after visiting the spa.

13.description: Mortal taxi driver in Miami who unknowingly helps transport demigods.
Hotel employee who helps check in the traveling heroes in Miami.

8.description: Beach safety officer who witnesses strange supernatural events but dismisses them.

15.description: Legendary Greek hero mentioned in connection to Polyphemus. The cyclops still remembers being blinded by him.
Ancient hero who originally sought the Golden Fleece with his crew of Argonauts.

11.description: Ancient sorceress mentioned in connection to Circe and the Golden Fleece myth.

15.description: Legendary crew of heroes who sailed with Jason to retrieve the Golden Fleece in ancient times.

19.description: Leader of the Party Ponies who arrives with Chiron to help defend Camp Half-Blood.
Centaur skilled with bow and arrow who joins the defense of Camp Half-Blood.
Centaur warrior wielding spears who helps fight off monsters attacking camp.

1.description: Children of Ares led by Clarisse, known for their aggressive nature and combat skills.

4.description: Empty cabin at Camp Half-Blood dedicated to Zeus, as the Big Three gods aren't supposed to have children.
Dark cabin dedicated to Hades, also empty due to the Big Three oath.

8.description: Cabin for children of Nemesis, goddess of revenge, known for seeking balance and justice.
Cabin for children of Hecate, goddess of magic, known for their sorcerous abilities.

1.description: Various nature spirits living at Camp Half-Blood, including tree nymphs and water nymphs.
Half-goat nature spirits who serve as searchers and protectors, like Grover.

19.description: Ancient Titan mentioned as an enemy of Poseidon and his forces.

1.description: Winged cleaning creatures that enforce curfew and clean up after campers.

8.description: Spiritual operators who help facilitate Iris messages across long distances.

19.description: Ancient Titan lord mentioned as the ultimate enemy gathering power to return.

2.description: English teacher at Meriwether Prep who assigns Percy difficult reading assignments.
Math teacher at Meriwether Prep who notices Percy's attention problems.
Fellow student at Meriwether Prep who tries to be friendly with Tyson.
Student who joins in bullying Tyson but runs when the Laistrygonians attack.
Student who witnesses the strange events during the dodgeball game.

3.description: Security officer who investigates the gym damage after the Laistrygonian attack.
Bus driver who takes students to and from Meriwether Prep, notices strange incidents.

1.description: New camper this summer, daughter of Demeter, still learning about camp life.
New camper who arrived just before Percy, son of Hermes.
Young new camper, daughter of Apollo, talented with archery.
Veteran camper, son of Ares, follows Clarisse's lead in cabin activities.
Long-time camper, daughter of Athena, helps train new campers in strategy.
Satyr who prepares meals for the camp, works in the dining pavilion.
Son of Apollo who runs the camp infirmary and treats injured campers.
Daughter of Athena who maintains the camp's collection of books and scrolls.
Son of Demeter who cares for the camp's pegasi and other magical creatures.
Various campers who work in the camp's strawberry fields as part of their duties.
Son of Apollo who teaches archery skills to campers at the shooting range.
Son of Ares who teaches sword combat techniques to campers.
Daughter of Athena who runs the arts and crafts activities at camp.
Son of Poseidon (distant relation) who teaches water activities at the lake.
Daughter of Ares who supervises the lava rock climbing wall.

5.description: Son of Hermes who organizes camp competitions and games under Tantalus.

recaps.1: Percy Jackson returns to Camp Half-Blood for his second summer, but strange things are happening. His dreams are filled with disturbing visions, and he senses something is wrong at camp.
recaps.2: At his new school, Meriwether Prep, Percy befriends a large homeless boy named Tyson who is picked on by other students. Percy has nightmares about Grover being in danger and calling for help.
recaps.3: During a dodgeball game that turns into a battle with Laistrygonian giants, Tyson reveals incredible strength defending Percy. Annabeth arrives to help, and they escape to Camp Half-Blood.
recaps.4: At camp, they discover that Thalia's tree has been poisoned, causing the magical borders to fail. Tyson is revealed to be a Cyclops and Percy's half-brother, both sons of Poseidon. Chiron is fired and replaced by Tantalus.
recaps.5: Tantalus, a spirit from the Underworld's Fields of Punishment, takes over as activities director. The camp becomes a more dangerous and unpleasant place under his cruel leadership.
recaps.6: The Oracle gives a prophecy about retrieving the Golden Fleece to heal Thalia's tree. Clarisse La Rue is chosen to lead the quest, much to Percy's frustration.
recaps.7: Percy continues having dreams about Grover being in danger. The empathy link between them reveals that Grover is trapped and needs rescue, but Percy isn't allowed on the official quest.
recaps.8: Percy, Annabeth, and Tyson decide to go on their own unofficial quest to rescue Grover and find the Golden Fleece. They encounter Clarisse, who reluctantly allows them to help.
recaps.9: The group travels toward the Sea of Monsters (also known as the Bermuda Triangle). They face various dangers and challenges as they journey toward Grover's location.
recaps.10: Continuing through the Sea of Monsters, Percy's powers over water help them navigate the dangerous supernatural waters filled with ancient monsters and magic.
recaps.11: The questers arrive at Circe's island, where the sorceress runs a health spa. She appears helpful at first but has sinister intentions for the male members of the group.
recaps.12: Circe reveals her true nature by turning Percy into a guinea pig. Annabeth must use her wits and Hermes' multivitamins to restore Percy and escape the island.
recaps.13: Percy befriends Rainbow, a hippocampus (sea-horse creature), who helps guide them through the treacherous waters of the Sea of Monsters toward their destination.
recaps.14: The group continues navigating the Sea of Monsters with Rainbow's help, facing various sea monsters and magical challenges as they get closer to Polyphemus's island.
recaps.15: They reach the island of Polyphemus, the cyclops who has captured Grover. The giant believes Grover is a female cyclops and plans to marry him. The Golden Fleece hangs in the cyclops's cave.
recaps.16: Percy and his friends infiltrate Polyphemus's cave where they find Grover in a wedding dress. They also discover the Golden Fleece, which has incredible healing powers.
recaps.17: Using the same strategy as Odysseus in the ancient myths, Percy blinds Polyphemus with a burning stick, allowing them to escape with Grover and the Golden Fleece.
recaps.18: The group successfully escapes Polyphemus's island with the Golden Fleece and the rescued Grover. They begin their journey back to Camp Half-Blood to heal Thalia's tree.
recaps.19: They return to Camp Half-Blood and use the Golden Fleece to heal Thalia's tree, restoring the camp's magical borders. However, the fleece's power is so strong that it brings Thalia back to life. Chiron is reinstated, Tantalus is banished, and Poseidon takes Tyson to work in the cyclopes' forges.
